summary: enteric viruses have been identified in intestinal tract of diseased poultry. astrovirus, coronavirus, parvovirus and rotavirus have been identified in meat-type turkey flocks. the prevalence of astrovirus infection was 44.9% (95% CI: 38.0-52.0), parvovirus 27.5% (95% CI: 21.6-34.2), rotavirus 18.8% (95% CI: 13.8-24.8) young turkeys aged 1-4 weeks old had the highest prevalence of viral infection.
